intro: Fagelia crenata, commonly known as the serrated fagelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Fagelia crenata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
